histogram.name: Signin
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions as they sign in through a flow. The suffix of the histogram indicates what UI widget or application flow triggered the signin flow.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountCapabilities.FetchDuration.{Result}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the fetch duration every time Chrome {Result} account capabilities from network. This is recorded only on Desktop platforms where Chrome implements its own account capabilities fetcher.

variant.summary: fails to fetch

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: successfully fetches

histogram.name: Signin.AccountCapabilities.FetchResult
histogram.summary: This histogram records the outcome of the account capabilities fetch operation. This is recorded only on Desktop platforms where Chrome implements its own account capabilities fetcher.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountCapabilities.GetFromSystemLibraryDuration{Caller}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the time it takes to fetch account capabilities from the system library {Caller}.

variant.summary: on every call (Android and iOS only)

variant.name: .SigninUpgradePromo

histogram.name: Signin.AccountCapabilities.GetFromSystemLibraryResult
histogram.summary: This histogram records the outcome of the account capabilities fetch operation. This is recorded only on Android and iOS where Chrome fetches the account capabilities from the system library.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountConsistencyPromoAction
histogram.summary: This histogram records the action taken by user after receiving the header from Gaia in the web sign-in flow. Currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountConsistencyPromoAction.{PromoEvent}
histogram.summary: Records the action taken by user after receiving the header from Gaia in the web sign-in flow. This histogram is another version of |Signin.AccountConsistencyPromoAction|, where the original one logs the promo events directly, and this histogram creates a variant for every promo event, and logs its access points instead.

variant.name: AddAccountCompletedWithNoDeviceAccount
variant.summary: User has added an account from a state without any on-device account.

variant.name: AddAccountStarted
variant.summary: User has tapped |Add account to device| from expanded account list.

variant.name: AddAccountStartedWithNoDeviceAccount
variant.summary: User has tapped |Sign Inâ€¦| from the no-default-account promo, starting an add-account flow.

variant.name: AuthErrorShown

variant.name: DismissedBack

variant.name: DismissedButton

variant.name: DismissedOther

variant.name: DismissedScrim

variant.name: DismissedSwipeDown

variant.name: ShownWithNoDeviceAccount

variant.name: SignedInWithAddedAccount

variant.name: SignedInWithDefaultAccount

variant.name: SignedInWithNoDeviceAccount

variant.name: SignedInWithNonDefaultAccount
variant.summary: User has selected one of the non default accounts and signed in with it.

variant.name: SignInFailed

variant.name: SuppressedAlreadySignedIn
variant.summary: The web sign-in is not shown because the user is already signed in.

variant.name: SuppressedConsecutiveDismissals

variant.name: SuppressedNoAccounts

variant.name: SuppressedSigninNotAllowed

variant.name: TimeoutErrorShown
variant.summary: The timeout error was shown to the user.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountFetcher.AccountAvatarFetchTime
histogram.summary:
The time it takes to fetch the account avatar for one account in AccountFetcherService. This is recorded every time a User Avatar fetch request from AccountFetcherService succeeds.
This histogram, along with Signin.AccountFetcher.AccountUserInfoFetchTime, will be used to decide whether to use OneGoogle library.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountFetcher.AccountUserInfoFetchTime
histogram.summary:
The time it takes to fetch the account information (except avatar) for one account in AccountFetcherService. This is recorded every time a User Info fetch request from AccountFetcherService succeeds.
This histogram, along with Signin.AccountFetcher.AccountAvatarFetchTime, will be used to decide whether to use OneGoogle library.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountReconcilorState.OnGaiaResponse
histogram.summary: Records the state of the account reconcilor when GAIA returns a specific response. The data in the "Inactive" bucket might be incorrect prior to M111.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountTracker.CountOfLoadedAccounts
histogram.summary:
Number of accounts loaded from preferences by the AccountTracker. Invalid accounts are not counted.
This is recorded on each profile load.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountTracker.GaiaIdMigrationState
histogram.summary:
This histogram records the AccountTracker account ID migration status from email to GAIA ID after the data is loaded from disk. It is more general than OAuth2Login.AccountRevoked.MigrationState that only record the event in case of errors and only on Android.
This histogram will be used to check whether the migration has completed for all active installs on a given platform or not (and whether the code can be removed).
This is recorded on each profile load.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountTracker.IsAccountIdEmpty
histogram.summary:
Indicates if the account being tracked by AccountTracker has an empty account id. This is recorded whenever AccountTracker starts tracking a new account.
This histogram will be used to decide the severity of AccountTracker receiving malformed account ids.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountType.SigninConsent
histogram.summary: Records the sign-in consent by regular Gmail account or managed account. Recorded when the user signs in (iOS only).

histogram.name: Signin.AccountType.SyncConsent
histogram.summary: Records the sync consent done by regular Gmail account or managed account. Recorded when the user signs in (iOS only).

histogram.name: Signin.AddAccountState
histogram.summary: This histogram records states in the add account process launched from Chrome on Android.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidAccountInfoFetchTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to fetch the account information (user names, avatar) for one account on Android. This is recorded when account information is downloaded in FRE or when there is an accounts change event.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidDeviceAccountsNumberWhenEnteringFRE
histogram.summary: Number of Android accounts on device when entering the First Run Experience sign-in screen.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidGetAccountIdsTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to retrieve Gaia ids for all accounts from GoogleAuthUtil.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidGetAccountsTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to retrieve the list of accounts from the system.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidIsFREStudyGroupConsistent
histogram.summary: Whether the persisted name of the FREMobileIdentityConsistencyStudy is consistent with the current value of low entropy source. Recorded on startup when the trial is registered.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidNumberOfDeviceAccounts
histogram.summary: The number of Android accounts present on the device. Recorded on startup.

histogram.name: Signin.AuthError
histogram.summary: Log the type of GAIA authentication error that occur whenever the error state changes.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.ChromeAccountRelation
histogram.summary: The relation between the account signed into chrome, and the account(s) in the cookie jar. This metric is never recorded when not signed into chrome.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.SignedInCount
histogram.summary: The number of signed in accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.SignedInCountWithPrimary
histogram.summary: The number of signed in accounts in the cookie jar for users that have a (possibly unconsented) primary account. Reported at most every 24 hours (using a persistent timer). Reporting is split based on the type of the primary account.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.SignedOutCount
histogram.summary: The number of signed out accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.StableAge
histogram.summary: The amount of time since the cookie jar last changed.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.TotalCount
histogram.summary: The total number of accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.DiceAuthorizationCode
histogram.summary: Recorded when a Dice signin response is received and indicates whether the authorization code was present or not.

histogram.name: Signin.DiceResponseHeader
histogram.summary: Records Dice responses (signin and signout).

histogram.name: Signin.DiceTokenFetchResult
histogram.summary: Outcome of the token fetch in Dice signin.

histogram.name: Signin.Enterprise.WorkProfile.ProfileCreatedWithPolicySet
histogram.summary: Whether the user chose to create a new work profile after a signin while profile separation is enforced by policy. This is recorded after the user accepts or refuses to create a new profile when shown the enterprise profile confirmation dialog and enterprise profile separation is enforced by policy.

histogram.name: Signin.Enterprise.WorkProfile.ProfileCreatedwithPolicyUnset
histogram.summary: Whether the user chose to create a new work profile after a signin while profile separation is not enforced by policy. This is recorded after the user accepts or refuses to create a new profile when shown the enterprise profile confirmation dialog and enterprise profile separation is not enforced by policy.

histogram.name: Signin.Extensions.GaiaRemoteConsentFlowResult
histogram.summary: Result of the browser remote consent flow, which is a part of the chrome.identity.getAuthToken() extension API call. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.Extensions.GetAuthTokenInteractivityStatus.{UiType}
histogram.summary: Records whether an interactive UI is allowed, when `chrome.identity.getAuthToken` is in interactive mode and attempts to show a "{UiType}" UI. If multiple UIs are shown by the same call, only the first one is recorded.

variant.name: Consent
variant.summary: OAuth consent

histogram.name: Signin.Extensions.GetAuthTokenNoGestureIdleTime.{UiType}
histogram.summary: Records the Chrome idle time, when `chrome.identity.getAuthToken` is in interactive mode, has no user gesture, and attempts to show a "{UiType}" UI. If multiple UIs are shown by the same call, only the first one is recorded.

variant.name: Consent
variant.summary: OAuth consent

histogram.name: Signin.Extensions.GetAuthTokenResult
histogram.summary: Result of the chrome.identity.getAuthToken() extension API call. Recorded right before returning the result to an extension. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.Extensions.LaunchWebAuthFlowResult
histogram.summary: Result of the chrome.identity.launchWebAuthFlow() extension API call. Recorded right before returning the result to an extension. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.GaiaCookieManager.Logout
histogram.summary: The number of requests initiated by the browser to log the user out from Google web. The Chrome account reconcilor enforces account consistency for Google accounts between the browser and web. In some cases it must force logout the user from Google web and then it sends a request to the Gaia logout endpoint. The expectation is that brower initiated logout is a rare event and should only occur in the following cases: a) it to be triggered when the browser fails to exchange an auth code for refresh tokens after a web sign-in (events which is counted by histogram Signin.DiceTokenFetchResult), b) when all refresh tokens are invalid (e.g when they cannot be loaded from disk).

histogram.name: Signin.GetAccessTokenFinished
histogram.summary: Reconds finished access token requests during Chrome reconcile, both successful or not, and return the GoogleAuthError state NONE is a success, other values are failures.

histogram.name: Signin.HadPreviousSyncAccount.SignedOutOnProfileLoad
histogram.summary: Records whether sync was turned on/consented on a profile at least once since the last time all profile data was wiped out (e.g. the user chose to clear data upon signout). This histogram is recorded upon profile load, and only for the case where the user is fully signed out.

histogram.name: Signin.HadPreviousSyncAccount.SyncOffOnProfileLoad
histogram.summary: Records whether sync was turned on/consented on a profile at least once since the last time all profile data was wiped out (e.g. the user chose to clear data upon signout). This histogram is recorded upon profile load, and only if sync is off (either the user is fully signed out, or the user is signed in without turning sync on).

histogram.name: Signin.Intercept.AccountInfoFetchDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of the account info fetch after signin interception.

histogram.name: Signin.Intercept.FRE.Event
histogram.summary: Records various events that occur during the first run experience after the sign-in interception.

histogram.name: Signin.Intercept.HeuristicOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the signin interception heuristic, which runs for each signin interception.

histogram.name: Signin.Intercept.ProfileCreationDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of the signed-in profile creation after signin interception.

histogram.name: Signin.Intercept.ProfileSwitchDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of the signed-in profile switch after signin interception.

histogram.name: Signin.InterceptResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the enterprise signin interception bubble. Recorded when the bubble is dismissed.

histogram.name: Signin.InvalidGaiaCredentialsReason
histogram.summary: Reason for invalid Gaia credentials. Recorded when Signin.AuthError records invalid credentials.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSDeviceRestoreIdentityCountAfter
histogram.summary: Records the number of identities after iOS device restore. Recorded at cold start when a device restore is detected, and only if the user was signed in before the device backup.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSDeviceRestoreIdentityCountBefore
histogram.summary: Records the number of identities before iOS device restore. Recorded at cold start when a device restore is detected, and only if the user was signed in before the device backup.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSDeviceRestoreSentinelError
histogram.summary: Records errors when creating sentinel files at cold start. Those sentinel files are used to detect a device restore. Histogram only for iOS.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSDeviceRestoreSentinelPathGenerated
histogram.summary: Records if the path for a sentinel file (used to detect iOS restore) is generated successfully. Recorded on cold start.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSDeviceRestoreSignedInState
histogram.summary: Records whether the user is signed in or signed out before and after a device restore. Recorded at cold start when a device restore is detected.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSGaiaCookieStateOnSignedInNavigation
histogram.summary: Records whether the Gaia cookie is present when a user signed in to Chrome navigates to a Google-owned domain that is eligible for Mirror account consistency. This metrics tracks the user journeys that interact with authentication cookies and that could be disrupted if an external force (e.g. Apple's ITP) were to remove these cookies. This logging is limited to once every hour due to performance constraints.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSLoginMethodAndSyncState
histogram.summary: Tracks the combination of sign-in method and sync state for signed-in users on iOS. If the user is signed in, this histogram is updated with the sign-in method and the sync state each time the application goes to foregrond. "Client Login" corresponds to users that have signed in via the legacy client login flow (Chrome iOS M27 and before). "Shared Authentication" corresponds to user that have signed in via the iOS Shared Authentication library. "Sync off" corresponds to users that have sync turned off. "Sync on" corresponds to users that have sync turned on.

histogram.name: Signin.IOSNumberOfDeviceAccounts
histogram.summary: Count of the number of SSO accounts present on the device. Note that this is different to the number of accounts signed in in Chrome. The count is logged in this histogram each time the application goes to foreground.

histogram.name: Signin.IsShared
histogram.summary: Current best guess if this device is shared between multiple users.

histogram.name: Signin.ListAccountsFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of ListAccounts call failure during account reconciliation, Chrome OS login, or signin internals queries.

histogram.name: Signin.ListAccountsRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed ListAccounts calls (these calls calls are used to fetch the list of Google accounts present in the Gaia cookies).

histogram.name: Signin.ListFamilyMembersRequest.Latency
histogram.summary: Tracks the latency of calls to the Kids Management API.

histogram.name: Signin.ListFamilyMembersRequest.NetOrHttpStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the net or http communication to the Kids Management API. This is recorded for each request to the Kids Management API (ListFamilyMembers rpc).

histogram.name: Signin.ListFamilyMembersRequest.Status
histogram.summary: The status of the fetch to the Kids Management API.

histogram.name: Signin.ListFamilyMembersRequest.{Status}.Latency
histogram.summary: Latency of the calls to the Kids Management API that resulted with "{Status}" status.

variant.name: AuthError
variant.summary: authentication error

variant.name: DataError
variant.summary: contract error (data in the response missing despite succesful parsing)

variant.name: HttpError
variant.summary: transport error

variant.name: NoError
variant.summary: no error recorded

variant.name: ParseError
variant.summary: parsing error

histogram.name: Signin.LoadedIdentities.Count
histogram.summary: Counts the number of identities loaded by SSO library using the keychain API. The metric is recorded every time SSO updates the identity list (either on the first run, or when the cache is staled). See: https://crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.LoadedIdentities.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to load identities by SSO library using the keychain API. The metric is recorded every time SSO updates the identity list (either on the first run, or when the cache is staled). See: https://crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.LoadedIdentities.DurationPerIdentity
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to load one identity in average by SSO library using the keychain API. This value is the total time taken by the keychain API to finish, divided by the number of identities returned. The metrics is recorded every time SSO updates the identity list (either on the first run, or when the cache is staled). See: crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.LoadTokenFromDB
histogram.summary: Action taken for tokens being loaded from the token database, at Chrome startup. Tokens can be either loaded into Chrome's token service or revoked.

histogram.name: Signin.Multilogin.NumberOfAccounts
histogram.summary: Number of accounts in tokens sent to Gaia Multilogin. Recorded when Chrome does a request to /oauth/multilogin.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2MintToken.ApiCallResult
histogram.summary: Result of the OAuth2MintToken API call. Recorded after the response is processed. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2TokenGetResult
histogram.summary: Reason fetching an OAuth2 Token failed or none in case of success. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2TokenGetRetry
histogram.summary: Reason fetching an OAuth2 Token is being retried. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuthMultiloginResponseStatus
histogram.summary: Response status received from gaia Multilogin.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AllExternalCcResultCompleted
histogram.summary: Records whether all external connections have been successfully checked (a value of "true") or not ("false") when the reconciler attempts to perform MergeSession.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.Duration.UpTo3mins
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the account reconciler using 100 buckets, up to 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.ExternalCcResultTime.Completed
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to successfully check all external connections whenever the reconciler performs a reconciliation.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.ExternalCcResultTime.NotCompleted
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to check only a portion of external connections whenever the reconciler performs a reconciliation. This means that either a network error occured while checking some sites or the site did not respond before the check timeout.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.Operation
histogram.summary: Records the operation executed by the reconcilor to reconcile the accounts (or no-op if the accounts are already consistent).

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.RejectedRequestsDueToThrottler.{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records the number of consecutive {RequestType} requests not allowed by the account reconcilor throttler due to back off time required between successive requests with the same paramaters. Recorded on the throttler destruction, a reset upon a new different request or a no operation reconciliation cycle or an allowed request upon a sufficient time to refill.

variant.name: LogoutAll
variant.summary: logout all

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.Trigger.{Operation}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the account reconcilor tries to change the cookie to match the tokens and performs a {Operation} operation. Records the event which triggered the reconcile.

variant.name: Throttled
variant.summary: throttled (cancelled)

histogram.name: Signin.RefreshTokenRevoked.Source
histogram.summary: Source for refresh token revocation. This is used to track the sources for signing out of Google accounts and is required to validate that the browser is not revoking tokens for large parts of the user population.

histogram.name: Signin.RefreshTokenUpdated.ToInvalidToken.Source
histogram.summary: Source for refresh token updated to invalid tokens. The refresh token is updated to an permanently invalid token when the user attempts to sign out of the primary account without turning off sync. This histogram is used to track the sources for invalidating the token of the primary account and is required to validate that the browser is not invalidating the token of the primary account for large parts of the user population.

histogram.name: Signin.RefreshTokenUpdated.ToValidToken.Source
histogram.summary: Source for refresh token updated to valid tokens. This is used to track the sources for adding Google accounts to the browser.

histogram.name: Signin.SetCookieSuccess
histogram.summary: This histogram records the success of setting each cookie after Multilogin response is received and parsed.

histogram.name: Signin.SignedInAccountsViewImpression
histogram.summary:
Track the number of times the view that displays the accounts that are signed is shown. This view only exists on iOS and is shown every time the application enters forground iff the accounts changed while it was in background. Only bucket "Shown" is being recorded (this histogram is a counter).
This histogram was added following crbug.com/1006717 (stable regression) where the signed-in accounts view was repeatedly shown for a set of users. It is used as a counter to monitor that there are no bumps in its timeline.

histogram.name: Signin.SignIn.Completed
histogram.summary: Records that the user signed in to Chrome, and logs the original access point associated with this event.

histogram.name: Signin.SignIn.Offered
histogram.summary:
Records that the option to sign in to Chrome was offered to the user, and logs the original access point associated with this event.
This histogram is still in development and has a limited coverage of the Signin access points for now.

histogram.name: Signin.SignIn.Started
histogram.summary:
Records that the user started the flow to sign in to Chrome, and logs the original access point associated with this event.
Notes:
- This histogram is still in development and has a limited coverage of the Signin access points for now. See go/chrome-signin-metrics-revamp for more context on the planned work.
- For the First Run, we log it once for the whole first run flow, it does not get recorded multiple times if the user steps back in the flow and chooses again to sign in.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninAbortedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Logs the original access point of each aborted sign in. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninAllowed
histogram.summary: Tracks the state of a user's signin-allowed preference. This is recorded at every startup.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Logs the original access point of each completed sign in.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninDisabledNotificationShown
histogram.summary: This histogram records the signin access point which was used when the signin disabled notification was shown. This is on Android only.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninReason
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of each completed sign in.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Logs the original access point that displayed the signin or reauth Gaia page, before the page is displayed.

histogram.name: Signin.SignOut.Completed
histogram.summary: Records that the user signed out of Chrome, and logs the original access point associated with this event. Note that turning off Sync almost always signs the user out, in which case both this histogram and Signin.SyncTurnOff.Completed are recorded.

histogram.name: Signin.SignoutDeleteProfile
histogram.summary: If the user chose to delete their profile or not when signing out of an unmanaged account. When the user is not given a choice this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Signin.SignoutProfile
histogram.summary: Track how a profile gets signed out.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOAuth.GetIdentities.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Tracks the error code by -[SSOService identitiesWithError:]. See: https://crbug.com/981082.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOIdentityListRequest.CacheState
histogram.summary: Tracks the SSO identity cache state before calling -[GCRSSOService identitiesWithError:] or -[GCRSSOService identitiesForDisplay]. See: https://crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOIdentityListRequest.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to call -[GCRSSOService identitiesWithError:] or -[GCRSSOService identitiesForDisplay]. See: https://crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOIdentityListRequest.FetchIdentitiesWithCallback.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time between -[GCRSSOService fetchIdentitiesWithCallback:] and the callback is invoked. See: https://crbug.com/897470.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOWKWebView.GetAllCookies.CookieCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of cookies returned by -[WKHTTPCookieStore getAllCookies:]. This histogram is to help to understand how many callbacks from |getAllCookies:| can be missing. And if the number of cookies is related in that iOS bug. See: crbug.com/880981.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOWKWebView.GetAllCookies.Duration
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes for -[WKHTTPCookieStore getAllCookies:] to finish and call its callback. Note that nothing is logged is -[WKHTTPCookieStore getAllCookies:] fails to calls its callback. This histogram is to help to understand how many callbacks from |getAllCookies:| can be missing, related to a bug from iOS. And if the number of cookies is related in that iOS bug. See: crbug.com/880981.

histogram.name: Signin.SSOWKWebView.GetAllCookies.Request
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times -[WKHTTPCookieStore getAllCookies:] is called and the number of times it calls its callback. This histogram is to help to understand how many callbacks from |getAllCookies:| can be missing, related to a bug from iOS. And if the number of cookies is related in that iOS bug. See: crbug.com/880981.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncConsentScreen.DataRowClicked
histogram.summary: This histogram records which sync data row was clicked by the user on the tangible sync consent page on Android and iOS.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncDisabledNotificationShown
histogram.summary: This histogram records the sync access point which was used when the sync disabled notification was shown. This is on Android only.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncErrorMessage{SyncErrorReason}
histogram.summary: Records various UI and user action events related to the sync error message. Android only.

variant.summary: Auth error.

variant.name: .ClientOutOfDate
variant.summary: Client out of date.

variant.name: .PassphraseRequired

histogram.summary: Tracks where FirstSetupComplete bit is set from.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncOptIn.Completed
histogram.summary: Records that the sync opt-in was completed by the user, and logs the original access point associated with this event. This is recorded when the user chooses to opt-in, whether they chose to proceed with the default settings or to open the sync settings first.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncOptIn.OpenedSyncSettings
histogram.summary: Records that the user chose to navigate to the sync settings page from the sync confirmation screen. Logs this in the context of the access point associated with this event.

histogram.name: Signin.SyncOptIn.Started
histogram.summary: Records that the sync confirmation screen was shown to the user, and logs the access point associated with this event. Note that due to some product quirks, this is recorded also when the "sync disabled" screen is shown, matching what happens with the completion event. See crbug.com/1398463 for more info.

variant.summary: the user presses on any button (except the dismiss cross) on

histogram.name: Signin.SyncTurnOff.Completed
histogram.summary: Records that the user turned off sync, and logs the original access point associated with this event.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenTable.GetAllTokensSqlStatementValidity
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the SQL statements to get all tokens is valid.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenTable.ReadTokenFromDBResult
histogram.summary: Counts the results of loading a refresh token from the token database.

histogram.name: Signin.TransactionalReauthResult
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user interacts with reauthentication to complete a transaction (like interacting with the account store for passwords) and whether the reauth challenge was cleared.

histogram.name: Signin.TransactionalReauthUserAction
histogram.summary: Records user actions performed in the reauthentication dialog/tab.

histogram.name: Signin.UberTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Reason of failure to acquiring an ubertoken based on an already-minted access token. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.UberTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failure to acquire an ubertoken based on an already-minted access token. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.UserRequestedWipeDataOnSignout
histogram.summary: User requested to wipe local device data on signout. This histogram is only recorded when the user is given a choice of whether or not to wipe data (not in cases where the data is either automatically wiped or automatically not wiped).
